intro: Otanema latifolia, commonly known as the "Bishop's hat," is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sun. Otanema latifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a potted plant.
